newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Philippine president begins Pakistan visit.
newsitem.headline: Philippine president begins Pakistan visit.

text.p: Philippine President Fidel Ramos arrived on Friday to a red-carpet reception for a three-day visit to Pakistan.
A 21-gun salute boomed out as the plane carrying Ramos from New Delhi arrived at Islamabad airport.
The Philippine president drove in a motorcade to the presidential palace in Islamabad where he was received by Pakistani President Farooq Leghari.
The two presidents later discussed matters of mutual interest, the official APP news agency said without giving details.
Ramos was later due to meet new Pakistani Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, it said.
Pakistani officials said the two sides were expected to discuss ways to coordinate efforts to fight terrorism.
The Ramos-Sharif talks will focus on bilateral matters as well as international issues of mutual concern, a Pakistani statement said.
The two sides will also discuss ways to strengthen economic and commercial ties.
